title: happy burns night 2020 story
story: Happy Burns Night ! Story of Robert Burns, his poems and how it is celebratedToday Scotland will celebrate the le and works of their national poet, Robert Burns, on what would have been his birthday. Heres everything you need to know for Burns Night Burns Night is celebrated with a traditional Scottish Burns Supper Image: newcastle chronicleByDaisy Naylor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsScotlandaposs national poet, Robert Burns, will be celebrated tonight -  January - on the anniversary of his birth. Family and friends come together to celebrate his le and works with a traditional Burns Supper consisting of haggis, whiskey and other traditional Scottish foods. Various Burns poems will be recited by guests throughout the evening, and Burnsapos most famous work - Auld Lang Syne - will be sung at the end of the night. Hereaposs everything you need to know on Burns Night , including the story of Burnsapos le, his most famous poems, and how Burns Night is traditionally celebrated around the UK. Who was Robert Burns A poet and lyricist, Robert Burns was born in Ayrshire, Scotland in . He was the eldest of seven children, and grew up in poverty on his familyaposs farm.While much of his childhood was spent doing manual labour, Burnsapos parents made sure that he received an education. He grew up reading the works of great writers, and was known for carrying a book wherever he went.His first attempt at poetry came when he was -years-old, and in love with a farm labourer called Nelly Kilpatrick. Burns wrote her O, Once I Lovaposd A Bonnie Lass . He grew up to be quite the womaniser, fathering his first child in  after an affair with Elizabeth Paton, who was one of his motheraposs servants. While Paton was pregnant Burns began a relationship with another woman, Jean Armour, who he met when she chased his dog away from her washing. She fell pregnant with twins in March , but her father forbade her to marry Burns.Burns then fell in love with a third woman, Mary Campbell, who he spotted in church. He wrote her ious poems, including Highland Mary , and there is some speculation that the pair planned to marry.It wasnapost to be. While nursing her brother, who had contracted typhus, Mary fell ill with the disease herself and died in October . Robert Burns poems Robert Burnsapos poetry career began to take off around the time of his relationships with Jean and Mary. He had been offered a job in Jamaica, and planned to emigrate.Burns didnapost have the money to pay for the journey, and so he began to sell his poems. He produced a collection, Poems, Chiefly in the Scottish Dialect , that was ultimately so successful that he decided against emigrating.  He stayed in Scotland and reconciled with Jean Armour. The pair married in , and went on to have nine children. Burns died in , at just -years-old. His years of hard labour as a child had weakened his constitution, and itaposs thought that he had a rheumatic heart condition. Burnsapos youngest son, Maxwell, was born on the day of his funeral. What is Burns Night  Burns Night marks Robert Burnsapos date of birth -  January - and celebrates his le and works. The tradition was started in  - just six years after Burnsapos death - by the Burns Club of Greenock. They held the very first Burns Supper on  January, which they incorrectly believed to be Burnsapos birthday. The following year parish records corrected their mistake, and they commenced the Burns Supper on  January. What are Burnsapos most famous poems Robert Burns was a lyricist as well as a poet, and his most famous work is probably the words to Auld Lang Syne . He also wrote poems that inspired the titles of Catcher in the Rye and Of Mice and Men . J.D. Salinger was inspired by poem Comin Thro the Rye , while Steinbeckaposs title comes from a line in The Mouse - aposThe best laid schemes o’ mice an’ men   Gang aft agley’. Burnsapos poem A Red, Red Rose may have inspired The Proclaimersapos song Iaposm Gonna Be , with the final lines aposAnd I will come again, my luve,Though it were ten thousand mileapos.How is Burns Night celebrated  Traditionally Burns Night will be celebrated by a Burns supper, where family and friends come together to celebrate the le and works of Robert Burns. This meal consists of a traditional Scottish soup, followed by haggis with neepsand tatties .Various Robert Burns poems will be recited throughout the evening, including Address to a Haggis when the haggis is brought in.After eating, a speaker will make a toast to the Immortal Memory of Robert Burns, giving a speech and then choosing their favourite Burns song or poem to perform. Then, a male guest will give an Address to the Lassies, which is a jokey speech that pays tribute to the women present at the Burns supper. A female guest will respond with a similarly humorous speech, the Reply to the Laddies.At the end of the evening, all the guests sing Burnsapos most famous work, Auld Lang Syne.This popular Highlander is perfect for sweet-toothed lovers. Featuring ripe banana and sweet orange zest, alongside a faint whf of honey, it’s the ideal tipple for an after-dinner treat.From £.For those doing dry January this year, you can still enjoy the wonderful taste of whisky - just without the alcohol. High Point drinks are a premium range of non-alcoholic fermented aperits and digests. From £.Although this one may be a little pricier than the rest, Burns Night is the perfect special occasion to whip it out. The award-winning Glen Scotia Victoriana is finished in deep charred oak, offering a smooth single malt whisky where aroma and flavour work in harmony.From £.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Robert Burns" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: home tiny wooden cell garden
story: Home with tiny wooden cell garden leaves claustrophobic house hunters in stitchesHouse hunters in Sheffield have been left feeling incredibly claustrophobic after coming across a one-bedroom property for sale, with what could be one of the smallest gardens in BritainThe propertys garden has caused a stir online Image: WhitehornesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterHelen Le Caplain:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA property listing has been ridiculed online after house hunters spotted that the aposprivate compact courtyardapos out the back isnapost much bigger than a aposwooden cellapos or aposshower cubicleapos.The one-bedroom house on Pinner Road in Hunteraposs Bar, Sheffield, has been advertised on Rightmove for £,. Whitehornes Estate agents have described the property as super quirky and claim itaposs likely to be incredibly popular with professional couples. However, the listing has proved popular online for other reasons.The outdoor area, which is a small, decked area, has been commented on by social media users who found the space to be rather claustrophobic.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. One person commented on Twitter : It’s actually pretty nice inside, a bit weird and a funny shape, but quite nice.For aposcompact courtyard gardenapos read aposwood-led shower cubicle with no views and no actual showerapos. Another person wrote: ‘Fresh air cell’ seems a good fit. Rolling on the floor laughing. A third posted: Somewhere to relax after work alongside a picture of Edd Munchaposs The Scream. While someone  proclaimed: I love how it talks about the area being great for children, with play-parks, nurseries, schools etc. Sorry, where the f**k am I storing the child in this property  The open-air, timber decking clad, child containment cell  And a dferent user added: That is triggering my claustrophobia just thinking about it. However, not everyone disliked the space as some saw the appeal - claiming it would make a great low-maintenance outdoor space. A seventh person pointed out: Low maintenance, into it.  The description on Rightmove reads: An incredibly rare opportunity has arisen to purchase this super quirky and inidually designed one double bedroomed, bay windowed terraced property.With accommodation spanning over three floors that offer a light, spacious and contemporary feel, number  will be incredibly popular with the professional couple, first-time buyer and those looking to invest in equal measures.With private compact courtyard garden, itaposs easy to say that viewing is absolutely essential to do full justice to this property. Perfectly placed on this well sought after residential road within a short stroll oh Sharrow Vale with its array of independent cafes, eateries, shops, Dyson place, Endclfe park is also on hand as is central Sheffield, universities, hospitals and of course The Peak District is right next door.Whitehornes Estate Agents and Rightmove have been contacted for comment.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: how de ice your windscreen
story: How to de-ice your windscreen and de-mist it quickly as artic weather blasts UKThe depths of winter are firmly upon us, but with commuters and kids still needing to get the car revved up every morning to make it school and work, the annual chore of de-icing your windscreen s - but how can you do it quickly Frosty and snow-covered windows are extremely unsafe Image: GettyByHarry ThompsonTrends Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsAs we plough on through the depths of winter, the appeal of a lie-in and indulging in a few more minutes in your warm cosy bed has never been so tempting. So the last thing anyone wants to see as they make the long trudge out to the car in semi-darkness is a windscreen blotted out with ice and condensation. Now, with the arrival of a biting arctic blast delivering a brutal -C freeze and the promise of weeks of snow and ice, this has never been more important. Sorting out the these common problems has made many late for work, and standing in the cold thawing your windscreen is far from ideal.The frozen fiasco is caused by moisture on the outside of the car car - usually rain or snow - freezing in extremely cold temperatures. Meanwhile, the mist on the inside is caused by any moisture within the car evaporating and then turning back to liquid when it hits the cold windscreen.So, what can be done about it  Read on for some tips on how to make your morning routine as painless as possible.How to de-ice your car safely and quickly  Hereaposs what you need to do to get going safely without damaging your car. Check your wipers Make sure your wipers arenapost on when de-icing your car. If they are, and the blades are stuck to the windscreen, their motor can become damaged. Always be sure this is the first thing you do in the process of preparing your caraposs windscreen. Start your engine Turn the position of the caraposs fans so they are pointing at the windows using the positioning dial on the dash board, then turn on the fan and set it to the highest heat possible by turning the dial up to full blast. If you have them, direct the rear fans on to the back window too. Like at the front, this will start to warm the glass up and help to get some of the ice on it to start thawing. Turn on the air conYour caraposs air conditioning will remove moisture from the air and stop the windows fogging up. Donapost use your hands to wipe the windscreen as this will leave greasy marks. Use the heat and air con together to start raising the temperature while also removing moisture from the atmosphere, so that you can simultaneously thaw and dry both the cabin and the windows. Clear off any snow Be sure to use a soft brush and clear anything covering the engine grill and lights.Use a can of de-icer and a scraper to remove any loose snow and ice on the outside windows of the car and make sure you get it all off.Drivers have been warned they could face a £ finethey start driving with any parts of their vehicle still covered with snow. How to de-mist your windscreen fast The process of de-misting your windscreen is similar to de-icing and involves getting to grips with the heating and air conditioning controls in your car. Point your heater vents at the windows and turn them on to a cool temperature. Then, slowly increase the heat before turning on the air con to remove the moisture from the air inside the car. If you donapost have air con, the best thing to do is to roll down the windows and wait for the temperature to stabilise. You may have a climate control setting in their car instead and,this is the case, be sure to use it as this can help to speed up the process. Another helpful thing to remember is that keeping your windscreen clean is vital for stopping it misting up in the first place. The secret trick  Shaving foam. Simply apply a thin layer of shaving foam over the windscreen and then wipe it off with a clean part of the same towel.The roads can be dangerous in the cold weather, especially when there’s snow and ice. Here are some top tips of how to drive safely in challenging conditions. tips to follow before you drive on snow and ice How to clear ice and frost off your windscreen quickly using one ingredient Other ways to de-ice and de-mist your windscreen fast  Highway Code tips on how to drive safely in the UK  common winter driving mistakes that could cost you £, Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON On The RoadWinterDangerous drivingSnowCars" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: inside prince andrews raunchy topless
story: Inside Prince Andrews raunchy topless holidays with infamous NyLon gangPrince Andrew was reportedly ordered by the Queen to dump his pals and their "murky world of cocaine, crime and casual sex" before he damaged the Monarchy foreverPrince Andrew on-board a yacht off the coast of Phuket in Thailand Image: Eliot Press   ELIOTPRESS   MEGAByDanya BazaraaSenior News ReporterRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Prince Andrew was reportedly warned he must cut ties from a gang of friends amid fears for the royal reputation as he partied in nightclubs more than  years ago.A  article by the Sunday People told how Prince Andrew was ordered by the Queen to dump his pals and their murky world of cocaine, crime and casual sex before he damaged the Monarchy forever. It spoke of the Queen and Prince Philipaposs fury after Andrew was pictured with topless women and touring red-light districts on a holiday in Phuket, Thailand. The Sunday People at the time revealed the Duke of Yorkaposs new friends were nicknamed the NyLon Gang because they went between New York and London with no expense spared.  Among the people in the gang was Ghislaine Maxwell, who it was said took Prince Andrew to nightclubs and parties.An insider told the Sunday People back in : Andrew has been told in no uncertain terms that he must cut loose from this gang with all their drug links before it drags the reputation of the Royals into the mire. His behaviour is not that expected of the Duke of York and he has been told it must end right now. Andrew is laying himself open to exploitation and scandal and is becoming an appalling liability. What sort of example does he set to the rest of the world  Reports have said Prince Andrew went on tours of red-light sex clubs with billionaire paedo Jeffrey Epstein and holidayed with pimp Ghislaine Maxwell while in Thailand. In a set of infamous photos, the Duke of York played up to his Playboy Prince moniker when he was seen surrounded by topless supermodels partying on a yacht off the coast of Thailand seaside resort, Phuket. Maxwell and Epstein were said to have been on the same holiday as Andrew, with the former thought to have stayed at his hotel. And the manager of a venue in Patongaposs red-light district said he was graced with a regal visit when the British prince visited the topless go-go bar. The wild holiday, which took place in New Year in , was around the time Prince Andrew became close with the couple - and just months before he allegedly sexually assaulted Virginia Giuffre.  Andrew has vehemently denied this allegation and claims there was nothing improper about his relationship with the couple - who were both convicted of child sex crimes in the US. The Duke of York splashed out £,-a-night on a private villa at the lavish and ultra-exclusive Amanpuri Hotel in Phuket - where the couple also stayed, reports say. A Phuket-based journalist known as Lana told The Sun Online the resort is the go-to place for high-profile figures who need a high level of luxury and privacy.Spending his days on yachts with scantily-clad women, by night the Prince reportedly teamed up with Epstein to visit Patong - a notorious sex tourism hub where the streets are lined with go-go bars, massage parlours and other adult entertainment venues.  The pair visited the Banana Disco - a popular tourist nightclub which advertises itself online with videos of women wearing not much at all. The Queenaposs second son was said to have repeatedly visited a bar called Crazy Girls by Rock Hard, which is in a raunchy area where many of the girls are prostitutes.On Facebook, it says punters can enjoy the craziest and sexiest ass-smacking bar.Speaking to The Sunday Mirror at the time, the manager said: I was amazed to see the Prince here. But he was not at all fazed and seemed quite relaxed until people realised who he was.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news kate-middletons-surprising-answer-after-"Prince William jokes no more kids on royal visit to BurnleyByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments The Duchess of Cambridgeaposs stylish wardrobe is the envy of many who are keen to recreate her outfits. So itaposs no surprise that when one fan was luckily enough to meet Kate on a recent engagement, she was able to ask for some inside info on the beautul tan boots she was wearing.However, when she asked the royal where sheaposd purchased the boots from, Kate gave a rather surprising answer.The exchange was caught on camera last week when Kate and husband Prince William visited Lancashire and paid a visit to Church on the Street in Burnley - a centre that helps people struggling with poverty, homelessness, addiction and other problems. There they met with Trudi and Alastair Barrie, who work at the centre, with Kate even cradling their young baby daughter Anastasia. As Kate cuddled the baby, Trudi can be heard asking: Where are your boots from, madam  Kate doesnapost immediately reply and appears to be distracted by a joke made by William.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. However, seconds later, Trudi then repeats the question, to which Kate seems to answer laughing: Oh I donapost even know. I should know. Itaposs unclear which brand the boots are from - although some royal fashion fans have speculated they could be from YSL. For the visit, Kate also wore a recycled £ Massimo Dutti that sheaposs been spotted wearing at two other engagements.  She teamed the coat with a gorgeous camel polo neck jumper and matching skirt.Meanwhile, at the same visit, William playfully ruled out having a fourth child as Kate cuddled baby Anastasia. The royal couple are already parents to Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis.As Kate cooed over the little girl, those around couldnapost help but say aww and William, looking at his we gazing at the baby, joked: Donapost give her any ideas, to laughter. He then told his smiling we: You canapost take her with you! However, itaposs not the first time that the couple has appeared to rule out baby number four - despite Kateaposs obvious love for children.In , on a visit to Northern Ireland, Kate met a five-month-old baby and admitted that it made her feel broody.When the babyaposs father cheekily asked: Baby number four  Kate joked: I think William would be a little worried. title: mum baby best friend surrogate
story: Mum has baby with best friend as surrogate after ending pregnancy over cancer diagnosisLorna Cattle, , from Chichester, Sussex, was diagnosed with cervical cancer in November  not long after she and Dan got married - the couple knew they would always be parents one way or anotherLorna, left, with her best friend Steph who was her surrogate Image: @leaftercervicalcancer   CATERS NEWSByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A mum who terminated her pregnancy after being diagnosed with cervical cancer has welcomed a baby boy with her best friend offered as her surrogate.Lorna Cattle, , from Chichester, Sussex, was diagnosed with cervical cancer in November .She then had to make the heartbreaking decision to terminate her pregnancy.Lorna, who works in HR, was given the all-clear in November  after months of radiotherapy, chemotherapy, and a hysterectomy. She and her husband Dan, , then started to look into fertility treatments when her best friend Steph Stretton, , offered to be their surrogate. Steph became pregnant following the transfer of an embryo in February  and gave birth to Joshua a month early in September . Lorna said: When I was diagnosed, I was six to eight weeks pregnant and the first thing we had to decide was whether it was a viable pregnancy which it wasnapost. We had got married in the summer and starting a family was always the plan so this was an awful decision for us to have to make but we were toldI continued, neither I nor the baby would survive. Iaposm a very optimistic person and never gave up hope on being a mum.  was when we first went to visit fertility doctors and spoke about our options and in , Steph came forward and said she would be our surrogate which I couldnapost have been more grateful for.  There are no words to explain the gratitude and awe I have for her. Being a mum is surreal Joshua is amazing and I feel extremely fortunate and grateful to have him in my le. Lorna and Dan planned on starting a family in , a year after they got married in Italy. However, Lornaaposs cancer diagnosis changed everything, leaving the couple to focus on her health.  The couple still wanted to be parents one way or another. Lorna added: When I was going through treatment, I was just focusing on getting better and didnapost want to worry about anything  so our plans of being parents were put on hold whilst I recovered. I had an oian transposition and lost my cervix meaning there was no chance I would be able to carry a child. But I always knew we would have a family one way or another, whether that was through adopting or surrogacy. We froze the embryos in December  and did our first transfer in February . I never expected a friend to come forward and offer to do that for us. for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information atwww.mirror email.It was a stressful lead up to the birth as Stephanie developed preeclampsia, but he came out perfect. Lorna still plans on having her friend Steph in Joshuaaposs le. Joshua, who weighed five pounds at birth, has just turned -weeks-old and now weighs  pounds. Lorna said: Steph lives in Cheshire so sheaposs far away from us but sheaposs still one of my closest friends and we see her when we can. I would highly encourage all women to go for their annual smear tests and push for answerssomething doesnapost feel right. Iaposd rather five minutes of embarrassment than months of treatment. news uk-news omicron-symptoms-your-ears-head-"Omicron: The first eight symptoms to look out forByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsInfection rates of the Omicron Covid iant are creeping back up, with UK Health Security Agencybosses confirming positive tests are up % on last week. Omicron is believed to be more transmissible than the previous Delta iant, but infection appears to be milder, similar to that of a cold. Now a ‘stealth’ version of the Omicron iant has appeared, leading to fears it could spark further waves of Covid- in the future.The strain, named as Omicron BA., has been classied as a “iant under investigation” by the UKHSA, but there are still huge gaps in our knowledge about the iant. It’s important to be aware of the symptoms of Omicron to avoid further spread of infection.  Here we take a look at some of the lesser known symptoms to look out for. What are the symptoms of Omicron The main symptoms of coronavirus are a new, continuous cough, a fever and a loss of taste and or smell, according to the NHS.However, symptoms of the Omicron iant have been described as milder.According to the ZOE Covid Study, the top five symptoms identied were a runny nose, headache, fatigue, sneezing and a sore throat.There are also other sign to look out for – particularly ones that affect your ears, eyes and head. Vertigo is a symptom that can occur during the “acute” phase of Covid infection, during the recovery process or as part of long Covid symptoms, says the NHS. Vertigo is a sensation of spinning or an altered sense of motion, or lightheadedness.The NHS adds: “Dizziness can also be linked with ringing in the ears, reduced hearing, eye strain and headaches.“These may come and go throughout the day. If they are constant or very intense, you should inform your healthcare professional as they may want to do some further investigations.”  According to the NHS, many studies have shown that Covid may cause headaches. It added: “Some people even get a headache before they notice any breathing problems. It is a common symptom of Covid. “Headaches are often a feature of other viral infections, but for most people the presence of a headache does not always mean that the virus is still present in the body.” According to Dr Konstantina Stankovic, chair of the Department of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery at Stanford University, ear pain is becoming a common sign of infection. Brits will be well aware of the three main symptoms of coronavirus – a new, continuous cough, a fever and a loss of taste and or smell. These are the officially recognised symptoms according to the NHS. However, with the new Omicron iant, symptoms have been described as being more similar to a common cold. Itaposs important to be aware of the symptoms in order to limit the spread of Covid. most common symptoms of Omicron, overtaking the  aposclassicapos Covid symptoms Is a rash a symptom of Omicron  Is altered taste a symptom of Omicron  Warning in your eyes doctor warns could be sign of Omicron Warning signs that the Omicron symptoms youaposre experiencing arenapost mind Omicron symptoms parents may be able to spot in children  least pleasant Omicron symptom – including dizziness  Her team found that some of those infected with Covid had inner ear symptoms. She told News: If you notice hearing loss or dizziness or ringing in your ears, donapost dismiss them. Get tested formally. In some of our patients, weaposve seen that hearing loss is the only sign of Covid infection.” If you experience any symptoms associated with Covid-, you should book a free PCR test from the NHS website. title: plumber taken aback after seeing
story: Plumber taken aback after seeing familys bleak living conditions pays for food and heatJames Anderson, , from Burnley, Lancashire, said it was so cold in the family of fives home he could see his breath and so gave them £ to put towards their food and energy billsPlumber James Anderson generously paid for a struggling familys utility bills Image: SWNSByKate LallyRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A kind-hearted plumber stepped in to help a desperate family pay for their utility bills.James Anderson gives emergency services to vulnerable people through Depher - a community initiative he founded - and was taken aback when he could see his own breath inside their home because it was so cold. The -year-old, from Burnley, Lancashire, gave the family-of-five £ to pay for food, gas and electricity to ensure they didnapost go hungry or freeze before their next payday.He described the job, which he was called out to on Saturday, as giving him a glimpse of actual poverty amid Britainaposs growing energy crisis, reports the Liverpool Echo. As energy bills skyrocket, tradesman James said similar scenes would soon be replicated around the country and called on the Government to act now to stop them.Have you been in a similar situation to James  Let us know at webnews@mirror  He said: “Where do we draw the line as a society and say aposNow we need to act apos “There’s a lot of stuff the Government can do to cut the cost of living by capping these companies that are charging stupid, extortionate, out of reality rates. “The poorest and the lowest in the country are always going to be penalised and expected to pay the most in the country out of everybody . It’s wrong, and it’s time for a change.”  James said he’d got a call from the family over the weekend as they were struggling to keep their heating on before they reached their next payday. He said: “They rang me to see whether there was anything we could do to help them get through until the next time they got paid. “I said I’d pop in and see what I could do. But when I got there, I realised the actual poverty that they’re living in and the impact all this is having on people. “You walk in and you’re talking to them, and you can see your breath while you’re talking to them. “They’ve got children there. They’re confused because they don’t know what’s going on. “The children are like aposWhy is this happening  Why am I cold  Why can’t my mum and dad keep me warm  Why can’t they put the boiler on  Why can’t they give me a meal apos Worryingly, James said this wasn’t the first time that he’d been in a home recently where he could see his own breath as families saved money by switching off their heating. He said: “Over the last few weeks, I’ve been to a few houses, not just families but elderly and disabled people as well, and you can see a plume of air coming out of their mouth. “It’s that cold you can see your words before you can bloody well hear them and that should not be acceptable in this day and age. You can donate to Depheraposs fundraising efforts here. news uk-news prince-harrys-bold-outburst-after-"Prince William and Prince Harry reunite at Diana statue unveilingByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Since the day he was born, Prince William has had his whole future le mapped out ahead of him.As an heir to the throne, he will probably one day be King and has been aware of his destiny from a young age.But according to one royal expert, his mother Princess Diana actually thought Williamaposs younger brother Prince Harry would actually make a better monarch - and even had a secret nickname for him.The late princess didnapost ulge why she thought her youngest son would be a better fit for the top job. But it has been claimed that William often confided in her that he didn’t want to be king”.  And in reply, a young Harry is said to have declared: If you don’t want the job I’ll have it. According to royal expert Robert Jobson, this led to Diana privately calling Harry GKH - or Good King Harry. He told the Channel  programme William  Harry: Princes At War : “She used to refer to Harry as GKHbecause she thought he’d probably be better equipped for the role in the future than William.” Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.Meanwhile, TV broadcaster Jeremy Paxman also said Diana talked about her sonsapos futures during a lunch meeting.He explained: We talked about our children and she said William often told her that he didn’t really want to be king, and then Harry would say, ‘If you don’t want the job I’ll have itapos.In , during her famous Panorama interview with Martin Bashir, the princess was askedthe title of King should go directly to William, who was then aged . She said: aposWell, then you have to see that William’s very young at the moment, so do you want a burden like that to be put on his shoulders at such an age  So I can’t answer that question.”However, with William now just months away from his th birthday, one royal expert has said she believes he is now matured into his future royal role.Speaking to OK! former royal correspondent Jennie Bond said: She [Diana] said that he found at that age, in his early teens, the burden of kingship was already weighing quite heavily on his shoulders.I think we did see a reluctance to take on the role earlier on, in his early adolescence, he knew his destiny as none of the rest of us do from such an early age. But in the last couple of years, he has shown convincingly that he is the man for the role and that he cares about being king. He absolutely fully accepts the role and the responsibility destiny has put his way. title: queen smiles joy prince philip
story: Queen smiles with joy with Prince Philip at Sandringham in newly-unearthed snapsThe heartwarming pictures of Her Majesty alongside her late husband were revealed shortly after she travelled to her Norfolk hideaway alone this weekThe Queen is seen alongside her late husband in one image dating back to the s Image: Edward Jackson   SWNSByBen TurnerLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan | comments Newly discovered pictures have emerged of the Queen smiling with Prince Philip at Sandringham just after she headed to the Norfolk hideaway alone this week.The photographs show the monarch with her late husband of more than  years and their son Charles. Princess Diana also appears in the pictures which date back to the s.The Queen is currently at her ,-acre Norfolk estate after spending her first Christmas without the Duke of Edinburgh. Now, fresh pictures have been unearthed of the Queen enjoying time with her family at Sandringham more than  years ago. The images were taken by amateur photographer Edward Jackson, who died aged  last November. In one photograph dated , the monarch appears alongside Prince Philip. Camera club member Edward, who worked as a newsagent, regularly visited Sandringham from his home in nearby Kingaposs Lynn, Norfolk. His family unearthed the images while clearing out a spare room in his house last Christmas. Nephew Stephen Jackson, , said: My uncle always had two cameras hanging around his neck just in case one went wrong. He was always on the lookout for a good shot.  Edward also spent time in London in the late s, where he used his Pentax camera to capture the Queenaposs Silver Jubilee celebrations. Edwardaposs family are submitting his photos to Kensington Palace after they issued an appeal for pictures of the Queen to mark  years on the throne. Stephen, an electrician, said: If Edward was still here he definitely would have sent some in. Weaposve picked half a dozen to send through.The Queen headed to her private bolthole in Sandringham to reflect after a traumatic  months, a royal expert has said.She was seen on Sunday making the emotional journey from Windsor Castle for a stay at the the five bedroom cottage Wood Farm. The late Prince Philip lived at the cottage following his retirement from public le and it was a place where the Queen and her beloved husband could relax together. title: tributes absolutely amazing boy 4
story: Absolutely amazing boy, , killed after bike smashes into lamppostThe boy - named locally as four-year-old Lennox Railton-Craggs - died following an off-road bike crash near Bishop Auckland, County Durham, on MondayLennox Railton-Craggs died on Monday Image: North News  Pictures northnewsByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan A four-year-old boy died after the off-road bike he was riding hit a lamppost. The child - named locally as Lennox Railton-Craggs - is thought to have been a passenger on the vehicle, which was involved in a crash in the Eldon Lane area, near Bishop Auckland, County Durham, on Monday afternoon. Emergency services were called to the scene shortly after pm and the child was treated for serious injuries. The youngster was then airlted to hospital by the Great North Air Ambulance Service but was pronounced dead on arrival.A Facebook tribute from Prince Bishops Community Primary School in County Durham said: As we’re sure many of you know, Lennox Railton-Craggs sadly passed away yesterday. Lennox was a joy. Have you been affected by this story  Let us know at webnews@mirror He was such a happy boy who always had a smile for staff and other children. He loved playing with the dinosaurs and in the water but his favourite thing to do was to play outside. He was an amazing friend and could be often seen holding another child’s hand and he would go and get a tissue for anyone who was upset. We’re absolutely heartbroken by the news.  Lennox will be hugely missed by all of the staff at school, especially those who were privileged enough to teach and support him. Naturally we have spoken to Lennox’s family and as always, will do what we can to support them through the unimaginable pain they are going through. As so many children had heard the news before they came to school today, we have spoken to them about bereavement, and we are providing support for them. The post was accompanied by a snap of Lennox with a model robot, which he had made during his time in nursery.  This is Lennox with a model robot he had made in nursery, the post continued. He was very proud of it and rightly so. This is how we will always remember him. Durham Police have now launched an investigation into the boyaposs death and have asked anyone with information regarding the incident to call them on  quoting incident number  of January . A spokesperson for the force explained: Police are investigating following the death of a four-year-old boy in Bishop Auckland. It is believed the child had been a passenger on an off-road bike when it collided with a lamppost shortly after pm yesterdayin the Eldon Lane area. He was airlted to the Royal Victoria Infirmary, in Newcastle, but was sadly pronounced dead on arrival.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON EducationHospitalsSchoolsDinosaursBicycles" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: unassuming terraced house britains smallest
story: Unassuming terraced house may have Britains smallest garden measuring just ft by ftCrushed in what appears to be an old window opening or coal shoot, the courtyard is only large enough for a single person to stand in, or perhaps two who are well acquainted at a pushThe living room of the property for sale is spacious - the garden, not so much Image: WhitehornesByEmily HallDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Jan | comments This unassuming terraced house may well have Britainaposs smallest garden - at around ft by ft. The one-bedroomed unique home is on the market with agents Whitehornes for £, with a green space described as a private compact courtyard garden.But buyers may be disappointed when they see the tiny outdoor space. Crushed in what appears to be an old window opening or coal shoot, the aposcourtyardapos is only large enough for a single person to stand in, or perhaps two who are well acquainted at a push. Despite having a fairly decent price tag, the area on offer barely looks big enough to fit a table and chair in, however it has been adorned with two small pot plants.  The home is up for grabs in the Sheffield district of Hunteraposs Bar, Sheffield, where the average terrace costs £,. The one-bed house is described as a super quirky and inidually designed one double bedroomed, bay windowed terraced property in estate agent details on rightmove. It goes on: With accommodation spanning over three floors that offer a light, spacious and contemporary feel, number  will be incredibly popular with the professional couple, first time buyer and those looking to invest in equal measures.  With a private compact courtyard garden, itaposs easy to say that viewing is absolutely essential to do full justice to this property.Perfectly placed on this well sought after residential road within a short stroll of Sharrow Vale with its array of independent cafes, eateries, shops, Dyson place, Endclfe park is also on hand, as is central Sheffield, universities, hospitals and of course the Peak District is right next door. And it adds: From Sharrow heading up toward Ecclesall Road and Hunters Bar, you really do see Sheffield in its erse glory. There are numerous shops, restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs spanning every genre making Ecclesall Road a vibrant and popular choice for a day or night shopping and or socialising.  With Sheffield Hallam Universityaposs Collegiate Campus being nearby, there are many investment opportunities for student housing. With Sheffieldaposs high retention rate of graduates, many young professionals look to rent in this area due to its cosmopolitan yet familiar feel. The city centre and train station is only a short bus ride away on a well run route making it a perfect choice for city workers and commuters alike.  The pad is also close to Endclfe Park - dubbed one of Sheffieldaposs most popular outdoor spaces, due to the many outdoor events held there such as traveling circuses, fairs and music events including tramlines. Ironically the brochure also boasts of the areaaposs large green spaces, which the new owner of this property may need. news uk-news woman-who-weighs--stone-"Plus-size model earns money selling videos of her getting stuck placesByLucy NotarantonioSam Elliott-Gibbs:,  Jan | comments A -stone woman says she earns over £, every month because men love watching her get stuck in doorways and in her car.Danielle Birch says her content is not sexual and she charges for her videos because some people love to admire bigger women. The -year-old, who lives in Plymouth, Devon, offers clips for £., with -minute versions available to buy at £.. She films her size  frame getting stuck in cars and doorways, as well as standing next to smaller people. Danielle says there is nothing pornographic about it - and just believes for some, bigger is better.  She said: “Thereaposs a lot of interest in seeing how my weight affects my daily le. “I used to wear baggy clothes to try and hide my weight but sharing my body online has boosted my confidence. I have realised that I may not be everyoneaposs cup of tea but there are people out there who appreciate my body. “I fall into the ‘supersized, big, beautul women’ bracket which is for ladies who weigh -lbs. “Iaposm lbs so evenI was to lose weight, I would still be in this category which seems to be very popular.” Danielle charges £. for five minute videos which will involve her trying on an outfit and £. for  minute videos. She adds: “The short videos are usually me trying on a cute outfit. “Whereas the longer ones might be a car tour which would show how I fit into one and others might be me getting stuck in a doorway. “Another video could involve squashing a smaller man or sitting in a hot tub causing the water to overflow. “Theres no denying what some people are using my content for without being crude but I do receive lovely messages from women.” Danielleaposs newfound love for her body has helped other women accept theirs too. The former chef also insists she isn’t promoting obesity.  She adds: “I am finally comfortable in my own skin but that doesn’t mean I am telling others to get fat. “I used to hate how I look but now I have a dferent outlook on it. “I don’t want to stay this size forever as I have limited mobility so I have reduced my calorie intake to , from , per day. I would be happy in size  clothing.” Danielle currently wears a size  on the bottom and  on the top. She paused her career as a chef and isnapost planning toto the kitchen any time soon.  “Now, I can use my weight to my advantage and make money, she added. “I can’t see myself going back to cheffing as it was long  hour days. Selling videos online gives me so much more freedom.” Danielle dedicates three days to filming content which is then posted throughout the week. She said: “I can earn money whilst on the go and it is on my terms. There isn’t anything pornographic about it. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  “Sometimes I may wear a sexy outfit but I never do rude things or get naked. “People purchase the clips rather than subscribing. On average I make £, per month but there has been months where I’ve earned more. Amongst the positive feedback, Danielle has been subject to trolling online. She adds: “Trolls and haters online say I look like a piece of meat and I am a disgrace. “They’ve also accused me of promoting obesity which I am not. I know this weight isn’t healthy but at the moment, I am fine with no underlying medical conditions. “I don’t know why my weight means I shouldn’t be able to love myself. “I think people should mind their own business,someone is struggling with their weight then being horrible and abusing them isn’t helping. news us-news harry-meghans-m-podcasts-taken-"Meghan and Harry release trailer for Archewell Audio podcast in ByChristopher BucktinUnited States EditorRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsPrince Harry and Meghan Markle ’s £ million Spoty podcasts are to be taken into the streaming giantaposs “own hands” after little content emerged.The company are hiring a number of in-house producers to help deliver on the deal after waiting more than a year for any material. They are recruiting new staff to work with Harry and Meghanaposs Archewell Audio in Los Angeles for podcasts that feature the voices of high profile women.” One advert for a senior producer role at Gimlet Projects, Spotyaposs in-house production arm, states: We’re currently assembling a show team that will build and launch a new original show with Archewell featuring the voices of high profile women.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here The ideal candidate has experience working with high-profile talent, and an interest in the intersection of social activism and popular culture.” The Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s only effort so far for Spoty has been a -minute aposholiday specialapos in December . It featured their friends James Corden and Elton John.  The couple’s lack of material comes despite the Sussexes employing podcast producer Rebecca Sanaes as their aposhead of audioapos at Archewell last year. A source told The Sun: Spoty has been waiting a long time for some content from Harry and Meghan and now it appears they have finally taken matters into their own hands. Hiring a raft of in-house talent on Spoty’s side will ensure they finally squeeze something out of them as they bid to honour their contract.It comes after a media lawyer suggested Harry and Meghan may not receive the full £ million from their contract with the streaming service.Speaking last month, media lawyer Ian Penman, who specialises in music streaming contracts, speculated that the venture is likely to have been less popular than Spoty and the royal couple expected.  He said: It would not be an unfair assumption that perhaps their popularity was not as great as maybe they or indeed Spoty initially felt. I think you could draw a conclusion that[Spoty] havenapost exercised the option on the next episode of the podcast, then maybe they did not have the popularity that either Meghan and Harry expected or indeed Spoty anticipated. Penman explained Spoty is unlikely to have lost out because they are unlikely to have paid the full £m upfront and are instead likely to have paid the Sussexes a small advance, retaining the right to back out of the contractthe first episode was not popular. He continued: It probably means that they have signed their first product, in this case, a podcast - they then have many, many options for further products. All those options are in Spotyaposs favour. Make no mistake, theyaposre not in Meghan and Harryaposs favour. After realising that the deal so far had cost them £, a minute, Spoty has reportedly been left mystied as to why the couple has not produced any content, according to The Sun. Meanwhile, Angela Levin, who has written a biography about the Prince, said: “Harry and Meghan want to do too many things at the same time.” The Mirror has contacted Spoty and Archewell for comment. news us-news inside-meghan-markle-prince-harrys-"Meghan and Harry release trailer for Archewell Audio podcast in ByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan | comments In December , Prince Harry and Meghan Markle announced their exclusive deal with Spoty to much fanfare. The streaming giant confirmed the royal pair would produce and host podcasts that uplts and entertains audiences around the world and feature erse perspectives and voices.The deal is reportedly worth £million and within days a trailer for the series, called Archewell Audio, was released. It was followed by a aposholiday specialapos episode lasting just over  minutes weeks later, with guests including James Corden and Sir Elton John.However, since then, there has been radio silence despite Spoty saying the first complete series was expected to drop in .  Here we take a look inside the multi-million-pound deal that seems to have gone sour... Signing the dealNews of Harry and Meghanaposs deal with Spoty first came in December . It followed them also signing an exclusive multi-year production deal for TV programming with Netflix having stepped back from royal duties earlier that year.At the time the partnership was announced, it was revealed that the coupleaposs newly formed Archewell Audio would produce programming that uplts and entertains audiences around the world and features erse perspectives and voices. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. In the trailer for the podcast, it opens with Harry saying: Shall we start  Ladies first  Before Meghan adds: No, say it because I think it sounds really nice with your accent. They then go on to introduce Archewell Audio. Meghan explains: One of the things my husband and I have always talked about is our passion for meeting people and hearing their stories.  And no matter what the story, they usually offer you an understanding of where someone  is coming from and at the same time remind you in some way of a story about yourself. Harry then continues: And thataposs what this project is all about, to bring forward dferent perspectives and voices that perhaps you havenapost heard before and find our common ground. When that happens, change really is possible. Holiday special  Around two weeks after the deal was announced, Archewell Audioaposs first full- podcast - a holiday special - dropped. It included interviews with a number of impressive guests, including Sir Elton John and James Corden, but they saved the most special until the end.The proud parents brought their son Archie to the microphone, with Harry saying: You can speak into it.Meghan then asks: Archie is it fun  and he repeats the word fun. The tot then copies his dad to say Happy New Year, followed by an adorable giggle.The podcast show notes description read: As we come to the end of the year, Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex, and Meghan, The Duchess of Sussex, present a special collection of inspiration, reflection, and perspective from guests around the world, including Stacey Abrams, Christina Adane, José Andrés, Brené Brown, Rachel Cargle, Deepak Chopra, James Corden, Matt Haig, Sir Elton John, Hussain Manawer, Naomi Osaka, Tyler Perry, and George the Poet .Curated throughout the month of December, join them as they reflect on the year, speak openly about the power of compassion, and toast to a hopeful . Wait for content However, following the holiday special, there has been no more episodes from Archewell Audio. This means the total running time of their podcast so far has been  minutes and  seconds. This means the podcast has cost around £,-a-minute for the content produced so far. Last year in June, the couple welcomed their baby daughter Lilibet and after her birth, they both took several months of parental leave.However, at the time, industry sources insisted the deal was still on track saying information on the next episode was expected later in the year.It was later reported that the couple had been given a gentle nudge to produce more content One source told the Sun : “Spoty were delighted when they signed the couple, but the lack of content has mystied them. Particularly as they seem to have no problem producing content for other s.”Less popular than expected  By the end of , new podcast episodes still hadnapost appeared - leading to one media lawyer to suggest Harry and Meghan may not receive the full £million for the deal. Speaking last month, media lawyer Ian Penman, who specialises in music streaming contracts, speculated that the venture is likely to have been less popular than Spoty and the royal couple expected. He said: It would not be an unfair assumption that perhaps their popularity was not as great as maybe they or indeed Spoty initially felt. I think you could draw a conclusion that[Spoty] havenapost exercised the option on the next episode of the podcast, then maybe they did not have the popularity that either Meghan and Harry expected or indeed Spoty anticipated. Penman explained Spoty is unlikely to have lost out because they are unlikely to have paid the full £m upfront and are instead likely to have paid the Sussexes a small advance, retaining the right to back out of the contractthe first episode was not popular. Spoty take charge Now it seems that Harry and Meghanaposs podcast venture is being taken into the streaming giantaposs “own hands”. Spoty are hiring a number of in-house producers to help deliver on the deal after waiting more than a year for any material. They are recruiting new staff to work with Harry and Meghanaposs Archewell Audio in Los Angeles for podcasts that feature the voices of high profile women.” One advert for a senior producer role at Gimlet Projects, Spotyaposs in-house production arm, states: We’re currently assembling a show team that will build and launch a new original show with Archewell featuring the voices of high profile women The ideal candidate has experience working with high-profile talent, and an interest in the intersection of social activism and popular culture.” The couple’s lack of material comes despite the Sussexes employing podcast producer Rebecca Sanaes as their aposhead of audioapos at Archewell last year. A source told The Sun: Spoty has been waiting a long time for some content from Harry and Meghan and now it appears they have finally taken matters into their own hands. Hiring a raft of in-house talent on Spoty’s side will ensure they finally squeeze something out of them as they bid to honour their contract. The Mirror has contacted Spoty and Archewell for comment. news weird-news i-dont-understand-people-think-"Tiktoker called Tuesday doesnt think she has a weird nameByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA woman who has never understood why people think name name is weird has turned to the internet for answers as to why it leaves others so confused.Tuesday was named after the day on which she was born, and has spent her whole le explaining the meaning to everyone she meets.She said that most people say the name is bizarre, but she likes it and canapost understand why people think it is unusual.Sheaposs now taken to TikTok to ask fellow users what they think of it - and sheaposs been inundated with praise. In a TikTok video, a woman asks: Whataposs the weirdest thing you have named your child What do you think about Tuesdayaposs name  Let us know in the comments...Tuesday saw an opportunity, and quickly replied: Ok so even though people still act like itaposs weird. Yaposall let me know is it weird  My nameaposs Tuesday. I donapost think thataposs a weird name. Other TikTok users rushed to Tuesdayaposs video to praise her for the unique name. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. One said: Not weird at all! If you were named Thursday, well.... but Tuesday is cool! While another commented: I think itaposs a cute name. And a third wrote: Nothing weird about the name Tuesday...it is original. I love it, added a fourth user.Meanwhile, a young woman had to change her name as a child because she was being bullied for her real name - as her parents had named her Ikea.Jasmine Dagless, , was named Ikea at birth after her mum saw a TV advert for the Swedish furniture store while pregnant, and she thought it sounded right. But when she grew up, Jasmine was dubbed aposflat packapos by school bullies who would cruelly joke about her unusual name. Eventually, sheaposd had enough of the bullying and legally changed her name after putting up with the insults for decades.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: i excited first date guy
story: I was excited for first date but the guy took one look and said I was too fatTikTok star Kailee Ross was excited to go on her first date with a potential love interest but the man told her, to her face, that she was too fat for him and she was devastatedKailee Ross had a terrible experience with online dating, and has now bravely shared her story Image: tiktok @kailzbailzByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman was devastated after being told she was too fat when she arrived for a first date. Kailee Ross had been speaking to the fellow singleton online and they were getting on well, so they decided to meet up at a restaurant for a proper date.Sharing the story on her popular TikTok page @kailzbailz, Kailee explains that she was really excited to meet the guy to seethere was a spark in real le.When they arrived they chatted outside the restaurant and seemed to hit it off - so far so good. But when they got inside things took a turn for the worst and the man said he felt no connection, and when pressed why he confessed that Kailee was too fat.  What do you think of the manaposs behaviour  Let us know in the comments...She explained: We got to talking and I thought the conversation was going great. We were talking for about five minutes and he looked over at me and said, aposhey - Iaposm going to be honest, Iaposm not really feeling a connectionapos. Kind-hearted Kailee then askedheaposd rather leave orthey should go ahead with the meal, and he opted to stay at the restaurant.  She continued: We sit down at our table and I took off my coat and he just looked at me. He said, aposyeah I thought so.apos She then asked what he meant by that comment, and he replied: Fitness and being healthy is really a big part of my le. Puzzled, Kailee asked him to explain, and the man said: Well, youaposre too fat for me.  Kailee was so shocked by his vile comments that she walked out, leaving him to dine alone. Later, she explained the whole story on TikTok and said the manaposs beauty standards were skewed. In the video, Kailee said: His exact words. Youaposre. Too. Fat. For. Me. What  Come on. I should have left as soon as he said he didnapost feel a connection [...]  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. I should have realised his personality was not one that I would want to continue to have in my le. Kaileeaposs video proved popular online and now it has over , views, with many users commenting on the clip to support Kailee. One said: Honey, I hope you walked out. You’re too GOOD for him. Then a second added: I would have stood up and yelled really loud aposyour sleeping with your sister! apos Then stormed out dramatically! A third wrote: The whole idea of saying heaposs not feeling it then still wanting to continue the date, sounds like a narcissistic move. It’s almost scary because you are NOT at all fat in any way, commented a fourth user. This is what causes girls to be skin and bones, dying of heart failure. You are gorgeous!Do you have a bad date story  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: innocent lunch box should send
story: Innocent lunch box should send alarm bells ringing for parents - can you spot why The lunch time offering looks very similar to what many parents send their children to school with, but according to nutrition experts the food inside should send alarm bells ringingThis lunch box snap has left experts concerned Image: Cancer Council NSWByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsThis seemingly innocent looking lunchbox should apparently be ringing alarm bells for parents - but can you spot why  The tin contains ham white bread sandwiches, crackers, a fruit roll up and a chocolate yogurt and looks pretty similar to what many of us tucked into at break time when we were kids.But according to Australian nutrition experts at the Cancer Council NSW, this meal could actually be doing more harm than good saying it hides an uncomfortable truth parents might not want to face.To highlight their concerns, they also shared a photo of a second lunchbox to seepeople can notice the dference. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.The second lunch box contains cheese and tomato sandwich, fruit, vegetable sticks and a yoghurt. The first box contains twice the sugar and half the second packed lunch. Andthat wasnapost enough to send alarm bells ringing for parents, the contents of the unhealthier box also happen to cost twice as much, due to most of it being pre-packaged items.Speaking to news.au, Cancer Council NSW’s senior nutrition program officer Nina Tan explained that many parents buy pre-packaged snacks for school because it saves time - or because children really want them.She said: When it comes to pre-packaged foods, companies are plastering them with nutrition-related marketing claims like ‘source of calcium’ or ‘no articial…’, and adding colours, cartoon characters and fonts designed to draw in both parents and kids.  Bright colours, cartoon animals and fun shapes are used to attract children, and text like ‘no need to chill’ and ‘the perfect lunch box biscuits’ are used to appeal to parents’ desire to make easy and quick lunch box choices for their kids, but these snacks can be packed with sugar, salt and kilojoules and often don’t provide children with the nutrients they need.Cancer Council NSW recently assessed  popular lunch box snacks in Australia and found nearly  per cent could be classied as unhealthy. Ms Tan added that they were particularly concerned by the results given the role lunch box snacks played in a children’s diet.In an attempt to tackle this concern, the council have since set up a website for parents to help them pack healthier lunches. You can find out more at https:healthylunchbox.au Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: man slammed horrendous demand plans
story: Man slammed for horrendous demand he plans to make of we after giving birthA podcast host has been called out after revealing the horrendous demand he intends to make of his future we after she gives birth, with his comments having sparked a fierce online backlashByJulia Banim:,  Jan | commentsThe period after a woman gives birth should be focused on ensuring she and her baby are safe, well, and cared for, and partners must remain mindful of the toll such a le-changing experience can take on a personaposs body.There absolutely shouldnapost, for example, be any pressure on new mums to aposbounce backapos physically after pregnancy and childbirth - with any mature and loving partner being more than happy to support them every step of the way. Therefore, itaposs understandable that many parents would take issue with those who take a less respectful approach to this sensitive topic, as demonstrated by a backlash sparked by new podcast,The No Filter Pod .Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.For those who havenapost tuned in, The No Filter Pod was launched earlier this month, with hosts Anthony Casasanta, Nick Casasanta, and Jason Girratano hailing it as “the most blunt podcast in the world”.Previous episodes see the hosts make assertions such as women cheat more than men!! and wing women donapost exist!!, prompting a fair bit of mockery in the comments section. However, one particular clip has gone viral which will exasperate anyone who has carried a child for nine months before going through the pains of labour, and indeed those whoaposve watched their other half go through it. In this vid, Anthony Casasanta can be heard claiming that,his future we lets herself go after childbirth, he would threaten to leave her.In the clip, which has been viewed over . million times on TikTok, Casasanta vows: If my we lets herself go after I have kids with her, I’m going to tell her once.If you don’t get your sh*t together, because I still want to be sexually attracted to my we, my spouse, butyou can’t do that, I’m out’. The comments on the TikTok video and Instagram have since been disabled, with the hosts telling the Mirror that they and members of their extended family have received death threats. However, this measure hasnapost stopped the ridicule from pouring in.Commenting under the full episode, which has been uploaded to YouTube, one person expressed concerns about innocent minds being influenced by such views, urging any young boys man girls women watching to treat yourself and women with respect and kindness and at the end that will get you what matters most. A second person remarked that they would like to see the hostsapos own mothers reacting to the vid, while a third stated that they would be filing orce papers that same daytheir spouse issued this sort of ultimatum.  One reaction video, from body confidence influencer Alex Light has gained signicant traction, having been viewed over .k times. In this clip, a visibly repulsed Light describes Casasantaaposs declaration as being one of the worst things I’ve seen for a long time.Light, who regularly makes videos about eating disorder recovery and diet culture, said: So, a woman – your future we, God help her – pushes an entire human out of her vagina and you want her to stay skinny, or at least get skinny, straight away – andshe doesn’t, you’ll leave her. What you’re saying is that when you get married, you’re not looking for a partnership, that’s not what you want. She continued: You want to own and control your we. You want her to look and behave a certain way – your way – you want her to conform to your standards andshe doesn’t, she’s gone. What a f***ing idiot man. In a joint comment made to The Mirror, the hosts said that although they expected the comments to be negative, they really feel as the video was taken out of context. The hosts claim they were talking years down the line after childbirth, rather than straight afterward, explaining that they just don’t want our wives to be obese.  The hosts continued: We feel associety promotes obesity which is a very unhealthy and uncomfortable way of living. We promote healthy lestyles here at NoFilterPod. It’s also not only about weight gain after childbirth, it’s also about mental health as well as physical health. We feel like it’s very important to hold spouses both men and women to a high standard.Considering those whoaposve ridiculed them online, the podcasters admit they are not sorry about the comments made during the episode, stating This is what we prefer and we’re allowed to have our opinion on things just like they’re allowed to have their views on certain things. They added: It’s none of our business what their opinion on things are, therefore they should respect our view. We hear and see all the hate that we are getting,you don’t like what we say simply don’t watch or listen to our podcast.Have you encountered this sort of attitude  Get in touch. news weird-news my-ex-hid-dodge-child-"TikTok user outlines how she catfished her exByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Jun Updated:,  Jan | commentsAccording to data, around  per cent of marriages will end in orce. On top of this, lots of couples never get married in the first place - so itaposs likely that the actual number of relationships is considerably higher. Whether it was an amicable breakup or incredibly awkward, children and shared finances can make even the nicest breakups a lot tougher. So what you need in this situation is for both parents to act like adults and move forward with kindness - for the childaposs sake at least. Butone of you doesnapost do that and allegedly refuses to help provide for the child youaposre meant to care off, well, all bets are off. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here One woman went to extreme s to track down her ex in order to ensure he paid his child support after he tried to avoid it.Mum Stephanie shared on TikTok how she managed to get her daughteraposs father to pay up after he disappeared.Dancing around cheerfully in a video on TikTok, she wrote: My daughteraposs bio dad stopped showing up two years ago. He hadnapost been paying child support and the courts couldnapost find him.But she managed to find him down - and get the vital information she needed, such as where he was living, for the court. She explained: I catfished him and got his address and where he worked. I sent all the info to support enforcement. Now I get child support weekly from his paychecks. Heaposs still behind k . Naturally, people who saw the viral video wanted to know exactly how she found him. She explained in the comments: I made a fake Snapchat. Itaposs the only one that doesnapost look fake because you donapost need an extensive friends history. In a follow-up video, the mum said that she had offered the man the opportunity to sign his parental rights away. She added: Iaposve tried. There are things that I canapost do because he still has parental rights. Itaposs his form of control, itaposs what they do. People were quick to praise her, with one saying: Thataposs incredible, Well done mumma! Another added: Thataposs my kind of petty. And I am here for it. story: My looks get me more male attention than my friends - they get jealous of meLily Pitfield, , says her good looks have driven a wedge between herself and her girlfriends because she attracts more male attention than her friends in clubsLily said her looks are driving a wedge between herself and her friendsByJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Jan | commentsHaving beautul looks might be many peopleaposs dream, with many assuming stunning people get things a little bit easier in le. But for one beautul woman with long blonde locks, a figure many would envy and gorgeous facial features, being attractive isnapost all itaposs cracked up to be.Lily Pitfield, , from Canary Wharf, told The Sun her looks are so envious, theyaposve caused a rt between herself and her group of girlfriends.The fashion assistant said her pals have been jealous of how she looks because it wins her more male attention. Lily first remembers attracting male attention when she was at a club - having a drink sent over to her despite not doing anything to suggest she was interested.For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here It was a huge confidence boost, up until then I had no idea how you look could influence how you’re treated, she said. After realising at a young age that she attracted a lot of male attention, Lily said the kind treatment she received has continued as sheaposs got older. But now when sheaposs out with her girlfriends, Lily is singled out because of her good looks - gaining her free entry to clubs and free drinks. “Itaposs caused a stir with my friends as they donapost get the same treatment, but I canapost help it, she said. Lily added she never expects to receive special treatment, but when sheaposs out and about it just does. The fashion student added sheaposs treated like a celebrity on holiday - having been invited on a cruise with an owner of a super yacht in  while on holiday in Greece where she was showered with delicious food and drinks. He wasnapost after anything in , he just said he hoped me being there would attract the aposcool crowdapos, she said. Lily said sheaposs fully aware not everyone receives the kind of treatment she does, and her family and friends constantly remind her how lucky she is. She said: Strangers are always nice to me, and I seem to always get what I want. title: woman kicks dads secret girlfriend
story: Woman kicks dads secret girlfriend out of his funeral after baffling conversationThe woman admitted she "lost it" when she saw her dads girlfriend of five years arrive at his funeral service, and forced her to leave as she hadnt been invitedThe woman didnt invite her dads girlfriend to the funeralImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writerMarita MoloneyDigital Reporter:,  Jan | commentsFunerals can be dficult for families to navigate at the best of times but they can be especially toughyou have a strained relationship with certain relatives. And one woman on Reddit has split the opinion of people online after she shared the story of her dadaposs funeral - as it also happened to be the first time sheaposd ever met his girlfriend of five years. Posting her story anonymously, the woman explained she found out about her dadaposs relationship two years after he started dating, after she saw text messages on his phone, the Irish Mirror reports.But her dad never spoke about his girlfriend, named Pam, and never introduced her to his daughter - leaving them to meet for the first time when she arrived uninvited to his funeral, which had been organised by his daughter. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.The woman wrote on Reddit : I was aposofficiallyapos told about Pam when I collected my dadaposs office things after he died, and a large photo of her was there. His colleagues were stunned I didn’t know. I threw that photo away right there. I made all the funeral arrangements. Pam tried contacting Dad’s phone messenger- I assume she saw all the posts on his Facebook and the funeral date online. I never responded to her.Yet before his wake started, Pam and her family showed up - and planned to be a part of the services! I came in at pm for the pm wake, and she and her three sons, daughters-in-law, and grandkids were there talking with some of his friends. She’s known them all for - years! The daughter was asked by the funeral directors and some guests why she hadnapost invited Pam, and she admitted it was because she didnapost know her - but Pam claimed the woman had refused to meet her.  She added: I was floored. The funeral people asked me why I didn’t include her since she’s his signicant other. I told them right in front of everyone that I’ve lived with my dad over the last five years and I never met or knew her. At this point, Pam got out of the provided chair and tried to play it cool by saying aposOh come now!apos while pulling me aside to aposchatapos. During this chat, she told me aposYou’re going to embarrass yourself and fatheryou don’t just keep it together. I canapost believe you refused to meet me until now but that was your choice. Now let’s get through this and figure it out later.apos The woman said she lost it at Pamaposs words, and kicked her dadaposs girlfriend and her family out of the service. She said: Pam wanted to stay because in her mind she was all but legally his we. I said no, because I’m the family, and she should have thought this through.  Right before the  pm service, she and her whole family left, and it was just me facing, among other things, constant questionings of aposWhere’s Pam  Why couldn’t Pam come  We saw Pam outside leaving, why did you do that apos Commenters on the Reddit post were split over whether the woman did the right thing, with some saying the real bad guy in the situation was her dad. One person wrote: Yikes. Based on what you’ve said here, the real a**hole is your dad. He told Pam you didn’t want to meet her, he didn’t tell you that she exists, and then he dies and leaves you to sort it out  While another said: Dad is the a**hole but so is Pam. Even with him telling her you didn’t want to meet. If I were in that position, the first thing anyone would do is talk to the daughter and offer sympathy.What do you think  Let us know in the comments below.At the very least not walk in there and act like it’s your show and you’re the centre of attention. She had no right to bring her whole family and start moving stuff around. But others sided with Pam, as they pointed out that she had just as much right to grieve the loss of her boyfriend as anybody  at the funeral. Someone posted: It seems like your dad told Pam that you didnapost want to meet her. I have been taught not to speak ill of the dead so I will go with [not an a**hole], but you are getting a pass only because you were clearly grieving. You were unconscionably rude to someone who was clearly very important to your father at a time when she was also grieving. As another agreed, writing: [Not an a**hole] but youaposre angry at your dad and Pam is a representation of everything he ever did wrong by you.Do you have a story to share  Email yourmirror@trinitymirrorRead MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON FuneralsRelationshipsUmm what Reddit" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
